intro: Commelina hirtella, commonly known as the hairy commelina, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its leaves are usually hairy, giving it the common name, and it produces small, delicate seeds. Commelina hirtella is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of wetland habitats.
